ygData.subject: Re: exp gain
ygData.msgSnippet: The XP Penalties/bonuses break down as follow: Human gets a 20% XP bonus over other races - all other races (Warrior class to avoid class penalty) gain xp at
ygData.messageBody:
The XP Penalties/bonuses break down as follow:

Human gets a 20% XP bonus over other races - all other races (Warrior class
to avoid class penalty) gain xp at the same rate (unless one of the
following applies)

Hybrids take a 20% xp penalty

XP giving kills in a "dungeon" zone give a 25% xp bonus

So a human pali would level at the exact same rate as a Dwarvish warrior.

There are other class restrictions, but I honestly don't know the
restrictions for them. I do, however, know that all INT based casters level
at the same rate if they're race xp penalty/bonus matches up.



>From: Michael_Wyatt@...
>Reply-To: EverQuest@onelist.com
>To: everquest@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EverQuest] exp gain
>Date: Wed, 15 Sep 1999 12:28:31 +1000
>
>
>
>
>All races other than humans have increased exp penalities,
>as do hybrid classes.
>
>Unfortunately it is very very difficult to measure this with any
>amount of precision, so I do not think anyone except the
>programmers have any clear idea on what the actual amounts are.
>
>Human Paladin vs Dwarven Warrior is a tossup - the human
>gets higher xp because he is a hybrid, the dwarf gets higher
>xp because he is a dwarf.
>
>It is safe to say that a Human Warrior will level faster than a
>Dwarven Paladin though.
>
>
>
>
>
